fs.gui
Class TabComponent

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  fs.gui.TabComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
EditCloseTabComponent
public class TabComponent
extends javax.swing.JPanel

This class implements a component that can be used as an easier-to-use extensible tab component. It is derived from JPanel (and will by default be non-opaque), so it can be manipulated like a standard component. It can be configured to automatically select the associated tab in a JTabbedPane after mouse click. However this can also be realised manually by adding an appropriate listener. Sub-components can be added with a special method, addClickTransparent(Component c) or by registering them as clickTransparents, so that every mouseClicked event on that component will be forwarded to the main JPanel (i.e. potentially interpreted as tab selection and also forwarded to every MouseListener registered the normal way).

Author:
Simon Hampe
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

TabComponent

public TabComponent()
Constructs an empty non-opaque TabComponent (i.e. JPanel) that does not forward any mouse clicks to an associated tab

TabComponent

public TabComponent(javax.swing.JTabbedPane associatedPane)
Constructs an empty non-opaque TabComponent that will on each mouse click invoke associatedPane.selectTabComponent(this); (if associatedPane is non-null)

Method Detail

getPaneToNotify

public javax.swing.JTabbedPane getPaneToNotify()
Returns:
the JTabbedPane that is notified (if notification is activated)

doesSelectTabOnClick

public boolean doesSelectTabOnClick()
Returns:
If a possibly associated JTabbedPane is notified of a mouse click (i.e. the associated tab is selected)

setPaneToNotify

public void setPaneToNotify(javax.swing.JTabbedPane paneToNotify)
Sets the JTabbedPane on which the associated tab should be selected. This should always be the JTabbedPane actually containing this component, otherwise this won't make any sense.

setSelectTabOnClick

public void setSelectTabOnClick(boolean selectTabOnClick)
Sets whether a possibly associated Tab should be selected on mouse click

selectAssociatedTab

public void selectAssociatedTab()
Tries to select the associated tab, if any JTabbedPane has been registered. If not, this call is ignored

addClickTransparent

public void addClickTransparent(java.awt.Component comp)
Convenience method that summarizes adding a component and registering it as a click transparent component. Adds a component in the regular way with the addition of registering a MouseListener with it (that will actually be the same for all components added this way), that will forward all mouseClicked-Events to the main JPanel (and thus also potentially select the associated tab). The MouseListener will only be unregistered on removal, if the component is removed with removeClickTransparent or by calling unregisterClickTransparent.

removeClickTransparent

public void removeClickTransparent(java.awt.Component comp)
Convenience method that summarizes removing a component and unregistering it as a click transparent component. Does the same as remove(Component comp), but additionally unregisters the MouseListener that forwarded all mouseClicked events to the main panel.

registerClickTransparent

public void registerClickTransparent(java.awt.Component comp)
Registers a component as a click-transparten component, i.e. all mouse clicks on this component will be forwarded to the TabComponent and all components on it. So registering a component not actually added to this TabComponent might result in unpredictable behavior. Forwarding is realized by adding a MouseListener to this component. It can be removed by calling unregisterClickTransparent on this component

unregisterClickTransparent

public void unregisterClickTransparent(java.awt.Component comp)
Removes the mouse listener that forwards mouse click events to the TabComponent
